reviewText: Both my 4 yr old & 2 yr old love Comfy Couch! Encourages imaginative play. After watching, I will hear my kids role playing what they watched, very sweet. Good material. Recommend.

I cannot give this any rating less than 5 stars.  I watched one episode the other day, prompting Amazon to ask me for my opinion.  My older 2 children were born in 1995 & 1997.  We faithfully watched The Big Comfy Couch and my children even had a replica of the couch that they sat on for TV watching.  We also had a Lunette doll and a Molly doll.  My girls LOVED this show.  Fast forward to this weekend, and my younger two children (born in 2006 & 2008) were looking for something different to watch and I stumbled across this.  Although it may not be as great as it seemed almost 20 years, I was happy to show off to all of my children that I still knew all the words to the opening song!  Although I may have been more impressed with myself than any of them were.  Still good for a nostalgic watch, although modern children expect too much in the way of animation to thoroughly enjoy.  It was great seeing Major Bedhead again also!
This show has been around for years. So glad I found it.  My granddaughter watched the first one just last week.  She loved it.  She just turned 3.

We just discovered this on Amazon prime and my 7 and 6 year olds (even my 1 year olds, too!) love this show.  It is calming for them and we use it as a quiet period option.  There are predictable moments (activities and phrases that are used every show) that provide the children with an assurance of regularity (such as daily stretching and cleaning up after play time) -- I love this part, too!  The episodes teach new vocabulary words, some not even commonly used these days, which serves to stretch the child's ability to understand the use of different words with the same meaning.  We LOVE this show.

Thanks, Amazon! My daughter with special needs LOVES these shows. When the show ended on tv, I never thought I'd never find them again. I purchased Seasons 2 &3 and plan to buy the rest of the seasons from Amazon as well. She is thoroughly enjoying them. Thanks also for providing Muppet Babies on vhs/dvd . Its shows like these that help a sick child's day go a little bit better :)

This show started in 1992 in Canada and was picked up by public broadcasting in the United States in 1995. My daughter was born in 1994 and I started watching with her when she was a little over one year old. Because there were only 13 episodes a season and the show was stripped five days a week, we ran through the 52 episodes of the series in about three months.  I remember how excited we were when we got the 13 new 1996 episodes. By that time we had already seen every previous episode four or five times.  I think we watched each of the original 65 episodes at least twenty times until my daughter was about four years and started pre-school. It was the only children's television show that I, as an adult, found as funny and charming as my daughter did.

My daughter is now 20 and gave birth to a baby girl, four months ago. We found the original episodes online and started watching them with the baby. The amazing thing was that the baby actually reacted to the clock rug stretch and started to move her arms and legs, trying to imitate Loonette's movements. We are both looking forward to watching the show again with the new baby. I can't wait to see the 26 additional episodes that were made. I hope the new Loonette is as great as Alyson Court was.
Cute for small children. My four year old really enjoys it. Teaches a small lesson with every episode. Time to stretch is her favorite part .

Simple and fun.  Good lessons.
No snarky insult humor. Wish they'd make some more.  It went off the air in late '90's I think. This show is it's own case for supporting public television.

It's self-consciously silly in a fun, friendly way. If your kids are going to watch TV, you might as well let them watch this.

Buyer Beware:

This is a really cool "old school" kids show that is not over the top theatrics and keeping things simple for kids to be entertained.  The only problem is the DVD itself.  The show I do believe was produced in Canada and it appears these DVD's are formatted that way.  The DVD works enough to watch a few episodes but then it just stops.  If your DVD player doesn't have multi formatting functions then watching this DVD probably won't happen.  Check your DVD player first before buying.  For the record, I bought a brand new updated DVD player that should have played the entire DVD but it didn't.  It didn't play the second disk.
I used to watch this show with my niece while babysitting and our favorite part was always 10 second tidy! She still sings when cleaning and she's in her 20's now.
